snippet.textDisplay:
People generally seem to praise Legaia 1 more than 2, but imo 2 was much funner to play. The art block system was improved(No more psyching up just to get another art block in combat) and there was much less times where you had to grind for a long time to be able to win. I got stuck in either the East or West Voz forests(I think thats the name) in L1 against the boss monsters there and was never able to pass it.

And in comparison to L2, I never got stuck where I couldnt advance except counting when I first played it as a kid and couldnt get passed the Gather Crab boss for a bit as I never figured out any other arts. The game was still challenging dont get me wrong, just no moments where you just get walled imo
snippet.textOriginal:
People generally seem to praise Legaia 1 more than 2, but imo 2 was much funner to play. The art block system was improved(No more psyching up just to get another art block in combat) and there was much less times where you had to grind for a long time to be able to win. I got stuck in either the East or West Voz forests(I think thats the name) in L1 against the boss monsters there and was never able to pass it.

And in comparison to L2, I never got stuck where I couldnt advance except counting when I first played it as a kid and couldnt get passed the Gather Crab boss for a bit as I never figured out any other arts. The game was still challenging dont get me wrong, just no moments where you just get walled imo

snippet.textDisplay:
@Blood Tears
The composers of the OST for Legaia 2 are:
Hitoshi Sakimoto
Yasunori Mitsuda
Michiru Oshima

While Nobuo did the music for many of the Final Fantasy games.
snippet.textOriginal:
@Blood Tears
The composers of the OST for Legaia 2 are:

Michiru Oshima

snippet.textDisplay: Legaia 2: Duel Saga was the only RPG where I spent over 100 hours doing all I could and didn't even go to the final boss. This RPG was good in the fact it had so much to do and of course the great combat system of the Legaia series made it a fresh experience at the time. You could actually cook food and make items up! All of that combines to make this game not only good...but TANZA HOT!!!
snippet.textOriginal: Legaia 2: Duel Saga was the only RPG where I spent over 100 hours doing all I could and didn't even go to the final boss. All of that combines to make this game not only good...but TANZA HOT!!!

snippet.textDisplay:
Bleh, it just wasn't near as good as the first one.  The world was extremely small, and the story had very very little depth, while the first one didn't have a whole lot of depth either, this one's just plain shallow.

The voice acting is annoying and... bleh it could've been so much better.  With the right accessories, bosses stop being a challenge, ever.  It's ridiculous.  Also Ayne is useless since he doesn't have an origin.  Bleh....
snippet.textOriginal:
Bleh, it just wasn't near as good as the first one.  The world was extremely small, and the story had very very little depth, while the first one didn't have a whole lot of depth either, this one's just plain shallow.

The voice acting is annoying and... bleh it could've been so much better.  With the right accessories, bosses stop being a challenge, ever.  It's ridiculous.  Also Ayne is useless since he doesn't have an origin.  Bleh....

snippet.textDisplay: I actually "won" the first fight and they force a cutscene of you getting your ass handed to you. Effectively 1 shotting both of them lol.
